Statements 1 is not correct:As per Article 53 of the Constitution of India, the executive power of the Union shall be vested in the President and shall be exercised by him either directly or through officers subordinate to him in accordance with this Constitution.
Statements 2 is not correct:As the President is the head of the Union Executive, all executive actions of the Government of India are expressed to be taken in the name of the President. (Article 77 (1) of the Constitution of India)
Therefore, option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Indian polity, consider the following statements:
1. In the case of division of States, the opinion of the State is binding on the Centre.
2. A minister can hold his/her position for a maximum period of 6 months without being a member of any House.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: To protect the unity and integrity of India, Article 3 of the Constitution vests the power to form new States in Parliament, which may pass the law on the subject. There is no requirement that Parliament shall consider the Assembly resolution, though it is mandatory that the President initiate the procedure and it ends with Parliament passing the relevant Bill.
Statement 2 is correct: If a person who is not a member of parliament is appointed as a minister he has to get elected to either house of parliament within six months. After six months he ceased to be a minister. In other words, a non-member may be appointed as a minister, but he/she will have to get elected to either house within six months.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following is not correct about the ordinances promulgated by the President of India?
(a) Ordinances are promulgated on the advice of the Council of Ministers.
(b) All ordinances are subject to the Judicial review. 
(c) An ordinance is promulgated only when both the houses of Parliament are not in session.
(d) The maximum validity of an ordinance is 6 months and 6 weeks.
batch.explanation:
The President of India can promulgate an ordinance when both the houses or either of the houses of Parliament is not in session. The ordinance is drafted by the council of ministers and the maximum validity of an ordinance is six months and six weeks.
All ordinances promulgated by both President and Governor are subject to Judicial review. 
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
The Electoral college of President consists of :
1. Elected members of both houses of Parliament
2. Elected members of both houses of State Legislatures.
3. Nominated members of Rajya Sabha.
4. Elected members of legislative assemblies of Delhi and Pondicherry.
How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) Only three
(d) All four
batch.explanation:
• The President of India is elected by indirect
election, i.e. by an electoral college, in
accordance with the system of proportional
representation by means of a single transferable
vote, and the voting is by secret ballot. The
Electoral College consists of:
Elected Members of the both the Houses of
Parliament.
Elected members of Legislative Assemblies
of States.
 Elected members of the legislative
assemblies of the Union Territories of
Delhi and Puducherry (included by 70th
Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992).
• This implies, that the following members are
not allowed to vote in the Presidential election:
 Nominated members of the Lok Sabha.
 Nominated members of the Rajya Sabha.Nominated members of the Legislative
Assemblies of State.
 Elected and Nominated members of the
Legislative Councils of States.
 Nominated members of the Legislative
Assembly of Delhi & Puducherry.                                                                                                                                   Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
At least how many days of prior notice is
required for the impeachment of the President
of India?
(a) 7 days
(b) 14 days
(c) 21 days
(d) 30 days
batch.explanation:
• The President can be removed from his office
by the process of impeachment for ‘violation
of the Constitution’.
• The impeachment charges can be initiated by
either House of Parliament. These charges
should be signed by one-fourth members of
the House (that framed the charges), and a 14
days’ notice should be given to the President.
• After the impeachment resolution is passed by a
majority of two-thirds of the total membership
of that House, it is sent to the other House,
which should investigate the charges.
• The President has the right to appear and to be
represented at such investigation. If the other
House also sustains the charges and passes
the impeachment resolution by a majority of
two thirds of the total membership, then the
President stands removed from his office from
the date on which the resolution is so passed. 
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. The Constitution of India defines the grounds for impeachment of the President.
2. The President of India cannot be removed from office except for the process and in the manner mentioned in the Constitution of India.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: The impeachment of the President is done on the grounds of violation of the Constitution of India, but there is no clear definition of the term “Violation of Constitution.”
Statement 2 is correct: The impeachment process is a quasi-judicial proceeding in the Parliament and the process of impeachment of the President has been mentioned in Article 61 of the Constitution of India. Thus, the President of India cannot be removed from office except for the process and in the manner mentioned in the Constitution of India.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements regarding President.
1. The President can be removed from office by process of impeachment for 'violation of consitution'.
2. The impeachment charges can be initiated only by the Lok Sabha.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The President can be removed from office by process of impeachment for 'violation of constitution'.
Statement 2 is not correct: The impeachmnet charges can initiated by either House of the Parliament.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Who among the following participates in both the election and impeachment of the President of India?
1. Elected members of Lok Sabha
2. All members of Rajya Sabha
3. Elected members of all state legislatures.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below:
(a) 1 only
(b) 1 and 3 only
(c) 2 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Only statement 1 is correct: The President of India is elected by an electoral college. The electoral college comprises elected members of: Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, Legislative Assemblies of the states and Legislative Assemblies of the Union Territories of Delhi and Puducherry. The electoral college does not consist of Nominated Members of Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha Nominated Members of Legislative Assemblies of States, including NCT of Delhi and Union Territory of Puducherry Members of Legislative Councils of states having bicameral legislatures. 
During the impeachment proceedings of the President, all members of the Parliament i.e. both elected and nominated participate. The members of the State Legislative Assembly and Council have no role in the process.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following Cabinet committees are headed by the Prime Minister?
1. Cabinet committee on Parliamentary Affairs.
2. Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA).
3. Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs.
4. Cabinet Committee on Accommodation.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 3 and 4 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 1, 2 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2, 3 and 4
batch.explanation:
Prime Minister heads the following Cabinet Committees:
1. Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC)
2. Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA)
3. Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS)
4. Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA).                                                                                                               Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs is headed by Defence Minister.
Cabinet Committee on Accommodation is headed by Home minister.                                                                                   Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. The President can establish a Tribal Advisory Council in a state which has Scheduled Tribes but does not have Scheduled Areas.
2. The President is empowered to direct that any act of Parliament does not apply to a Scheduled area.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
a. 1 only
b. 2 only
c. Both 1 and 2
d. Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The President can establish a Tribal Advisory Council in a state with scheduled Tribes but not Scheduled Areas.
Statement 2 is not correct: The Governor not the President is empowered to direct that any act of Parliament does not apply to a scheduled area or apply with specified modifications and exceptions.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to the Vice-President of India, consider the following statements:
1. The Vice President acts as the President if a vacancy is caused because of resignation or removal or death of the President.
2. He/ She is elected by an electoral college which consists of the members of both Houses of the Parliament including the nominated members.
3. He/She is elected according to the system of proportional representation by means of a single transferrable vote 
How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) All three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The Vice President acts as the President, if a vacancy is caused because of resignation or removal or death of the President.
Statement 2 is correct: He/She is elected by an electoral college which consists of the members of both Houses of the Parliament including the nominated members.
Statement 3 is correct: He/She is elected according to the system of proportional representation by means of a single transferrable vote, and the voting is by secret ballot. 
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements about the Vice-President of India:
1. He/She shall be ex officio Chairman of the Council of the States and shall not hold any other office of profit.
2. In the event of the occurrence of any vacancy in the office of the President,he/she shall act as President.
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
(a) Only 1
(b) Only 2
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statements 1 is correct:The Vice-President as the ex-officio
Chairman of Rajya Sabha (article 54) In
this capacity, his powers and functions
are similar to those of the Speaker of Lok
Sabha.
Statements 2 is correct:The Vice-President acts as President when a
vacancy occurs in the office of the President
due to his resignation, removal, death or
otherwise.
• He can act as President only for a maximum
period of six months within which a new
President has to be elected [article 62(2)].
Therefore option (c) is the correct naswer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance
batch.sub_topic: Vice President of India-- Functions and powers

batch.text:
With reference to removal of the Vice-President, which of the following statements is/are correct?
1. Constitution of India does not mention any ground for removal of the Vice-President.
2. A resolution for removal of the Vice-President requires to be passed by an absolute majority in both Houses of the Parliament. 
3. A resolution for removal of Vice-President can only be initiated in Rajya Sabha.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 2 and 3 only
(b) 3 only
(c) 1 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Constitution of India does not mention any ground for removal of the Vice-President.        Statement 3 is correct:A Resolution for removal of the Vice-President can only be initiated in Rajya Sabha.
Statement 2 is not correct: Vice-President can be removed from office by a resolution of the Rajya Sabha), passed by a majority of its members at that time (i.e. effective strength of the House) and agreed to by Lok Sabha by simple majority. 
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Provisions pertaining to anti-defection are enshrined in which of the following Schedules of the Constitution?
(a) Second Schedule
(b) Fifth Schedule
(c) Eighth Schedule
(d) Tenth Schedule
batch.explanation:
The 52nd constitutional Amendment added the Tenth Schedule to the Constitution commonly referred to as the anti-defection law.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
In which of the following. cases, a Member of Parliament or a Member of legislative assembly will not be disqualified under the anti-defection law?
a) If a political party merges with another political party with at least one-third members in favour of merger.
b) If any nominated member joins any political party before the end of 6 months.
c) If any member, who is independently elected, joins any political party.
d) If a member votes or abstains from voting in the House, contrary to any direction issued by his political party.
batch.explanation:
Option a is incorrect: Under Anti-defection law a party is allowed to merge with or into another party provided that at least two-thirds (not one-third) of its legislators are in favour of the merger. In such a scenario, neither the members who decide to merge, nor the ones who stay with the original party will face disqualification.
Option b is correct: If any nominated member joins any political party before the end of 6 months, then the members will not get  disqualified under anti-defection law.
Option c is incorrect: An independent member of a House (elected without being set up as a candidate by any political party) becomes disqualified to remain a member of the House if he joins any political party after such election.
Option d is incorrect: If he votes or abstains from voting in the House, contrary to any direction issued by his political party, then the member is disqualified from the membership of the house under anti-defection law.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to the anti-defection law,
consider the following statements:
1. It allows a group of 2/3rd of MP/MLAs
of a particular party to join (i.e. merge
with) another political party without
inviting the penalty for defection.
2. The Speakers of both the State
Assemblies and the Parliament have to
decide on disqualification petitions for
members.
3. The decision of the Presiding Officers
of the Legislature in the matter of
defection cannot be challenged in a
court of law.
How many of the statements given above is/are
correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: It allows a group of 2/3rd of MP/MLAs of a particular party to
join (i.e. merge with) another political party without inviting the penalty for defection.
Statement 2 is correct: The Speakers of both the State Assemblies and the Parliament have to decide on disqualification petitions for members within three months except for the existence of an extraordinary circumstance.
Statement 3 is not correct: The Supreme Court has held legislators can challenge their decisions before the higher judiciary.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Who among the following cannot be disqualified under the provisions of the tenth schedule of the Indian constitution?
(a) Any person elected as chairman or speaker can resign from his party, and rejoin the party if he admits that post.
(b) Any member who is independently elected joins any party. 
(c)  A nominated member who joins any political party after the end of 6 months.
(d) An elected member who gives up his membership of a political party voluntarily.
batch.explanation:
The Tenth Schedule of the Indian Constitution mentions the provisions for disqualification of MPs and MLAs on the grounds of defection. The members of a house (MP/MLAs) can be disqualified if: 
1. The elected member voluntarily gives up his membership of a political party. 
2. If the member votes or abstains from voting in the House, contrary to any direction issued by his political party. 
3. If an independently elected member joins any party. 
4. If any nominated member joins any political party after the end of 6 months.
5. The decision on disqualification questions on the ground of defection is referred to the Speaker or the Chairman of the House, and his/her decision is final. All proceedings in relation to disqualification under this Schedule are considered to be proceedings in Parliament or the Legislature of a state as is the case.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to the Election Commission, which of the following statement is correct?
(a) Parliament has enacted a law for appointment of the members of the Election Commission.
(b) The conditions of service and tenure of election commissioners is decided by the Parliament.
(c) Regional commissioners are appointed by the Chief Election commissioner.
(d) Election Commissioner can be removed from the office only on the recommendation of the Chief Election Commissioner.
batch.explanation:
Option (a) is not correct: Constitution authorises the Parliament to make laws for appointment of the members of the Election Commission. The Parliament, however, has not enacted any law in this regard which has given rise to issue neutrality and merit in the appointment of the members to the Commission.
Option (b) is not correct: The conditions of service and tenure of election commissioners and regional commissioners shall be decided by the President.
Option (c) is not correct: The President appoints the regional commissioners after consultation with the election commission.
Option (d) is correct: Any other Election Commissioner or a Regional Commissioner can be removed from the office only on the recommendation of the Chief Election Commissioner.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Delimitation commission, consider the following statements:
1. It is constituted by the Central government on the recommendations of the election commission.
2. The Parliament can amend recommendations of the commission.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
a. 1 only
b. 2 only
c. Both 1 and 2
d. Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: The demarcation of the constituencies is done by the Delimitation Commission constituted by the Parliament. The delimitation commission is established by parliament
Statement 2 is not correct: The recommendations of the Delimitation Commission cannot be amended by parliament or challenged in the Supreme Court. However, parliament could debate and discuss these recommendations.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), consider the following statements:
1. The Constitution lays down various elaborate qualifications for appointment of Chairman of the UPSC.
2. If the office of the Chairman of the commission becomes vacant the President can appoint any of the members of the commission to act as a chairman.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: The constitution doesn’t lay down the elaborate qualifications for the chairman or the members, it only says that as nearly as may be the one-half of the members of every Public Service Commission shall be persons who at the dates of their respective appointments have held office for at least ten years either in the Government of India or under the Government of a state.
Statement 2 is correct: The constitution has also made provisions to deal with absence of chairman, here the President is empowered to appoint any of the members of the commission to act like a chairman, If the office of the Chairman of the commission becomes vacant, or the Chairman is not able to perform his duties by reason of absence or any other reason.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Joint State Public Service Commission (JSPSC), consider the following statements:
1. The Constitution provides for the establishment of a Joint State Public Service Commission (JSPSC) for two or more states.
2. A JPSC has never been formed in India.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The Constitution, under Article 315, makes provision for the establishment of a Joint State Public Service Commission (JSPSC) for two or more states.
Statement 2 is not correct: The two states of Punjab and Haryana had a JSPSC for a short period, after the creation of Haryana out of Punjab in 1966.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. The State Election Commissioner is appointed and removed by the same authority.
2. Article 148 to 151 of the constitution deals with powers, function, tenure, eligibility, etc of the members of the Election Commision of India.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is incorrect: The State election commissioner, though appointed by the Governor of the State, can be removed only by the President.
Statement 2 is incorrect: Article 324 to 329 of the constitution deals with powers, function, tenure, eligibility, etc of the commission and the member.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following is not true about the Consolidated Fund of India?
(a)  It is the account of the revenue the Government of India receives
(b) The Contingency and Public fund of India are part of the consolidated fund.
(c) Any withdrawal from this fund requires the approval of Parliament. 
(d) Fund allocation to different ministries is done from this fund.
batch.explanation:
Article 266(1) of the Indian Constitution mentions the Consolidated Fund of India. It is the account of the revenue the Government of India receives via income tax, Customs, central excise and the non-tax revenue and the expenses it makes, excluding exceptional items. 
The Contingency and Public fund of India are not a part of the consolidated fund.
Any withdrawal from the Consolidated fund requires the approval of Parliament and the fund allocation to different ministries is done from this fund. 
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance
batch.sub_topic: Financial Relation betwen Centre and State

batch.text:
According to the Constitution of India, a Member of Parliament (MP) can be disqualified for which of the following actions?
1. Voluntary acceptance of foreign citizenship.
2. Conviction for election offences.
3. Preventive detention on grounds of creating violent unrest.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 1 and 2 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 1 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: According to Article 102, a person shall be disqualified for being chosen as, and for being a member of either House of Parliament if that person is not a citizen of India, or has voluntarily acquired the citizenship of a foreign State, or is under any acknowledgement of allegiance or adherence to a foreign State.
Statement 2 is not correct: Conviction for election offences is a ground for disqualification in Representation of the People Act (1951) and not in the constitution.
Statement 3 is not correct: Preventive detention on grounds of creating violent unrest is not a ground of disqualification neither in the Constitution nor in the Representation of the People Act (1951).
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Union Territories, consider the following statements:
1. Parliament can legislate on subjects in the State list with respect to Puducherry and Delhi.
2. The Legislative Assembly of Delhi can make laws on all the subjects of State List and the Concurrent List.
3. The President can make regulations for the peace, progress and good government of all the Union Territories.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Parliament can legislate on any subject in the three lists (including matters in State list) with respect to all Union Territories and also Puducherry and Delhi.
Statement 2 is not correct: Legislative Assembly of Delhi can make laws on all the subjects (except public order, police and land) of State List and the Concurrent List.
Statement 3 is not correct: The President can make regulations for the peace, progress and good government of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Lakshadweep, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, and Daman and Diu.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Parliamentary Committees, consider the following statements:
1. Standing Committees are permanent committees that work on a continuous basis. 
2. Ad hoc Committees are appointed for a specific purpose and they cease to exist when they finish the task assigned to them.
3. The members of Departmental Standing Committees are from Lok Sabha only.
How many of the statement/s given above is/are correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) All three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statements 1 is correct: Standing Committees are permanent and regular committees which are constituted from time to time in pursuance of the provisions of an Act of Parliament or Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha. 
Statement 2 is correct:Ad hoc Committees are appointed for a specific purpose and they cease to exist when they finish the task assigned to them. 
Statement 3 is not correct: Department Standing Committees have 31 members 21 from Lok Sabha and 10 from Rajya Sabha.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to legislative procedure in parliament, consider the following statements:
1. A money bill can be introduced in either house of parliament.
2. During the first reading of an ordinary bill only the title and objectives of the bill are introduced.
3. All the changes and amendments in a bill are carried out during the second reading of the bill.
How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Money Bill may only be introduced in Lok Sabha, on the recommendation of the President. It must be passed in Lok Sabha by a simple majority of all members present and voting. Following this, it may be sent to the Rajya Sabha for its recommendations. 
Statement 2 is correct: During the first reading/ first stage of an ordinary bill only the title and objectives of the bill are introduced.
Statement 3 is correct: All the changes and amendments in a bill are carried out during the second reading of the bill. It is the stage where detailed discussions on every aspect of the bill are carried out. 
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Who among the following presides over the session of the Lok Sabha if the office of Speaker and Deputy Speaker are vacant?
(a) President
(b) A member of Panel of Chairperson
(c) A member appointed by the Union Cabinet for the purpose
(d) A member of the House nominated by the President
batch.explanation:
When the Offices of both the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker fall vacant, the duties of the Office of the Speaker are performed by such Members of the Lok Sabha as the President may appoint for the purpose. Any member of the Panel of Chairperson presides over the House only in the absence of the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker. 
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to language to be used in Indian Parliament, consider the following statements:
1. Business in Parliament should only be transacted in Hindi.
2. The Speaker of the House of the People can allow any member to address the House in his mother-tongue.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Business in Parliament should be transacted in Hindi or in English.
Statement 2 is correct: The Chairman of the Council of States or Speaker of the House of the People, or person acting as such, as the case may be, may permit any member who cannot adequately express himself in Hindi or in English to address the House in his mother-tongue.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to the types of majority required in India for law making, consider the following statements:
1. Absolute majority refers to the majority of 60 percent of total members present and voting in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha together.
2. Effective majority refers to a majority of more than 50% of the effective strength of the House
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Absolute majority refers to the majority of more than 50 percent of total strength of house i.e. Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha.
Statement 2 is correct: Effective majority refers to a majority of more than 50% of the effective of the House and is calculated by subtracting vacant seats from total seats in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha both.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to No-confidence motion, consider the following statements:
1. A motion of no confidence can be introduced only in the lower house of the assembly or parliament.
2. The Speaker's permission is required first and the motion has to be supported by at least 50 MPs.
3. Only Ballot vote is used to cast the vote.
4. In India, if a no confidence motion is passed against an individual minister they have to resign along with the entire council of ministers.
How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) Only Three
(d) All Four
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: It can be moved only in the Lok Sabha. The procedure is laid
down under Rule 198 of the rules of procedure and conduct of business of the Lok Sabha. 
Statement 2 is correct: The Speaker's permission is required first; and the motion has to be supported by at least 50 MPs. 
Statement 3 is not correct: These are the modes by which voting can be conducted:
i. Voice vote: In a voice vote, the legislators respond orally.
ii. Division vote: In case of a division vote, voting is done using electronic gadgets, slips or in a ballot box.
iii. Ballot vote: Ballot box is usually a secret vote,the Supreme Court has declined request for a secret ballot.
Statement 4 is correct: If a no confidence motion is passed against an individual minister they have to resign along with the entire council of ministers. 
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to Money Bill, consider the following statements:
1. All money bills are financial bills, but all financial bills are not money bills.
2. The President can call a joint sitting of both houses of Parliament to resolve a deadlock over a money bill.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: There are three kinds of Financial Bills in Indian parliament:
1. Money Bills.
2. Financial Bills category-I.
3. Financial Bill category-II.
Thus, all money bills are financial bills, but all financial bills are not money bills.
Statement 2 is not correct: A joint sitting of both houses of Parliament cannot be called to resolve a deadlock over a money bill. Money bill can only originate in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha must pass the bill within 14 days with or without amendments. Lok sabha can or cannot accept the recommendation. If the bill is not passed by the Rajya Sabha within 14 the bill will be assumed to have been passed. Thus, there cannot be a deadlock over a money bill.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
In India, the Speaker of the Lok Sabha
1. Decides the questions of disqualification of a member of the Lok Sabha on the grounds of defection.
2. Summons the joint sitting of both the houses of Parliament.
3. Chairs the Business Advisory Committee and Rules Committee.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 and 3 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 1 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The Speaker decides the questions of disqualification of a member of Lok Sabha, arising on the ground of defection, under the provisions of the 10th Schedule of the Constitution. The decision of the Speaker is subject to Judicial Review.
Statement 2 is not correct: The Speaker presides over the joint sitting of both houses of the Parliament, whenever it is summoned by the President to resolve the deadlock.
Statement 3 is correct: Speaker is the chairman of the Business Advisory Committee, the Rules Committee, and the General Purpose Committee.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance
batch.sub_topic: Parliament-- Speaker of the Lok Sabha

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. Both elected and nominated members participate in the election process of Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
2. The Speaker of the Lok Sabha must resign from the party to remain politically neutral.
3. Pro-tem Speaker usually presides only for the first sitting of the newly elected Lok Sabha.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below:
(a) 1 and 3 only
(b) 2 only
(c) 2 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Both elected and nominated members participate in the election process of Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
Statement 2 is not correct: In India, the Speaker generally belongs to the majority party and does not resign from the membership of the party upon selection to the post of Speaker. In Britain, the Speaker is strictly a non-party person, and there is a convention that the Speaker has to resign from his party and remain politically neutral.
Statement 3 is correct: Usually, the senior most member is selected as Pro-tem speaker. The President himself administers the oath to the Speaker Pro Tem. The Speaker of the Lok Sabha does not take any separate oath for the post. Pro-tem speaker presides only over the first sitting of the newly elected Lok Sabha. His main duty is to administer oaths to the new members. He also enables the House to elect the new Speaker. When the new Speaker is elected by the House, the office of the Speaker Pro Tem ceases to exist.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance
batch.sub_topic: Parliament-- Speaker of the Lok Sabha--Election

batch.text:
Which of the following is/are mentioned in the Rules of the Lok Sabha but not in the Constitution of India?
1. Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha
2. Leader of the Opposition
3. Leader of the House
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 1 and 2 only
(b) 1 and 3 only
(c) 3 only
(d) 2 and 3 only
batch.explanation:
The office of Deputy Speaker is mentioned in the Constitution of India. But the offices of Leader of the Opposition and Leader of House are mentioned in the Rules of the Lok Sabha.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to national emergency in India, consider the following statements: 
1. National emergency can be proclaimed on the grounds of external aggression, war and armed rebellion.
2. Whenever a national emergency is proclaimed it automatically becomes applicable to the entire country. 
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a)  1 only
(b) 2 only
(c)  Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Article 352 deals with the provisions of national emergency in India. The national emergency in India can be proclaimed on the grounds of external aggression, war and armed rebellion. The term “armed rebellion” was inserted by the 44th constitutional amendment act and it replaced the word “internal disturbance”. 
Statement 2 is not correct: The territorial extent of national emergency is as specified in the proclamation. A national emergency can be applicable to the entire country as well as to any/specific parts of the country. 
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. While a national emergency is in force, the state legislature is suspended.
2. The approval of resolution for proclamation and revocation of national emergency requires a special majority in both the houses.
3. The tenure of national emergency cannot be extended beyond five years. 
How many of the above given statements are not true?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c)  All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statements 1 is not correct:While a national emergency is in force, the state legislature and executive are not suspended as the grounds of national emergency are not political in nature.                                                                                         Statements 2 is not correct:The approval for proclamation of national emergency requires a special majority in both the houses whereas the revocation of national emergency requires a simple majority in Lok Sabha only. 
Statements 3 is not correct:The tenure of national emergency can be extended for an infinite period. The extension of national emergency requires approval by both the houses every six years. If it is extended beyond five years, the Lok Sabha can also be extended for 1 year at a time. 
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following provisions was not introduced by the 44th Constitutional Amendment in the context of the emergency?
(a) The term “internal disturbance” was replaced by “armed rebellion” in respect of national emergency.
(b) The President can declare a national emergency only on the written recommendation of the cabinet.
(c) It provided that the enforcement of fundamental rights guaranteed by Articles 20 and 21 cannot be suspended during a national emergency.
(d) It added the provision that the proclamation of national emergency can be declared for a specific part of territory of India.
batch.explanation:
Statements a, b and c are correct: The 44th Constitutional Amendment did the following changes in context to emergency:
1. The term “internal disturbance” was replaced by “armed rebellion” in respect of national emergency.
2. The President can declare a national emergency only on the written recommendation of the cabinet.
3. It provided that the fundamental rights guaranteed by Articles 20 and 21 cannot be suspended during a national emergency.                                                                                                                                                                             Statement (d) is not correct: The 42nd (and not 44th) Constitutional Amendment of 1976 added the provision that the proclamation of national emergency can be declared for a specific part of territory of India. A proclamation of national emergency thus may be applicable to the entire country or only a part of it. The 42nd Amendment Act of 1976 enabled the President to limit the operation of a National Emergency to a specific part of India.

Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. A proclamation of financial emergency requires approval of both the Houses of Parliament within one month.
2. A financial emergency can be extended for an infinite period of time subject to approval by parliament every six months.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statements 1 is not correct: Article 360 empowers the President to proclaim a Financial Emergency if he is satisfied that a situation has arisen due to which the financial stability or credit of India or any part of its territory is threatened. A proclamation of financial emergency requires approval from both the Houses of parliament within two months.         Statements 2 is not correct: A financial emergency can be extended for an infinite period of time and repeated approval by parliament is not required for it. A proclamation of Financial Emergency may be revoked by the president at any time by a subsequent proclamation. Such a proclamation does not require parliamentary approval.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following powers have been given to the Gram Sabhas under the Panchayats (Extension to the Scheduled Areas) Act 1996?
1. Consultation in matters of land acquisition. 
2. Regulation of money lending to Scheduled Tribes (STs). 
3. Manage major water bodies
4. Consultation in anti naxal operation.
Select the correct answer using the code given below: 
(a) 1 and 3 only
(b) 2 and 4 only 
(c) 1 and 2 only 
(d) 1, 2, 3 and 4
batch.explanation:
Gram Sabhas or Panchayats at the appropriate level shall have powers –
• To manage minor water bodies.
• Power of mandatory consultation in matters of land acquisition.
• Resettlement and rehabilitation and prospecting licences/mining leases for minor minerals.
• Power to prevent alienation of land and restore alienated land.
• Regulate and restrict sale/consumption of liquor.
• Manage village markets.
• Control money lending to STs.
• Ownership of minor forest produce.
• To exercise control over institutions and functionaries in all social sectors.
• To control over local plans and resources for such plans including tribal sub-plans.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance
batch.sub_topic: Panchayats (Extension to the Scheduled Areas) Act

batch.text:
With reference to Gram Sabha, consider the following statements:
1. Only people above the age of 18 are eligible to become members of the Gram Sabha.
2. Gram Sabha is the only permanent unit in the Panchayati Raj system.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Gram Sabha consists of all the persons registered in the electoral rolls relating to a village within the area of Panchayat at the village level. People only above 18 can be registered in the electoral rolls.
Statement 2 is correct: Gram Sabha is the only permanent unit in the Panchayati Raj system and is not subject to dissolution.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. 73rd Constitution Amendment Act, 1992 is not applicable to the Sixth Schedule areas.
2. The President can extend the provisions of this Part to the scheduled areas and the tribal areas.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The 73rd amendment Act 1992 via part IX of the constitution provides that it is not applicable to the Sixth Schedule areas.
Statement 2 is not correct: The parliament (not the President) may by law, extend the provisions of Part IX to the scheduled areas and the tribal areas, subject to certain exceptions and modifications.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which among the following states does not have Fifth Schedule area? 
(a) Andhra Pradesh
(b) Karnataka 
(c) Madhya Pradesh 
(d) Rajasthan
batch.explanation:
States having Fifth Schedule Areas:
At present, 10 States namely Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Rajasthan and Telangana have Fifth Schedule Areas. 
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
With reference to the concept of federalism, consider the following statements:
1. Federal constitution provides for expression of regional goals and national objectives.
2. Federation is suitable to a plural society but with limited cultures and few language speaking populations.
3. For a Constitution to be federal, it must be written, rigid and supreme law of the land.
How many of the statement/s given above is/are not correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Federal constitution provides for expression of regional goals and national objectives.It can accommodate the aspirations and sovereign interests of different provinces with ethnic groups, linguistic characteristics.
Statement 2 is not correct: Federation is suitable to a plural society with multiple cultures and multiple language speaking populations.
Statement 3 is correct.Essentials for Federal Character: The Constitution must be written, It must be rigid, It must be supreme law of the land.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Which of the following constitutional amendment act was enacted to implement the scheme of States reorganization?
(a) 1st Constitutional Amendment Act
(b) 3rd Constitutional Amendment Act
(c) 7th Constitutional Amendment Act
(d) 11th Constitutional Amendment Act
batch.explanation:
7th Constitutional Amendment Act enacted to implement the scheme of States reorganisation.
Therrefore option (c) is correct answer.
batch.subject: Polity and Governance

batch.text:
Consider the following  Acts.
1. The Atomic Energy Act, 1962
2. The Environment Protection Act, 1986
3. The Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act, 2010
The Atomic Energy Regulatory Board (AERB) derives its regulatory authority from which of the above Acts?
(a) 1 and 3 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 1 and 2 only
(d) 2 only
batch.explanation:
The Atomic Energy Regulatory Board was constituted on November 15, 1983, by the President of India by exercising the powers conferred by the Atomic Energy Act, 1962 to carry out certain regulatory and safety functions under the Act. The regulatory authority of AERB is derived from the rules and notifications promulgated under the Atomic Energy Act and the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following substances.
1. Liquid Sodium
2. Heavy Water
3. Graphite
Which of the above can be used as both a coolant and a moderator in a nuclear reactor?
(a) 1 and 2 only
(b) 2 only
(c) 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Heavy Water acts as both a coolant and moderator in a nuclear reactor.
Coolant: The nuclear reactor uses a coolant that removes heat from the core where the fuel is processed and carries it to electrical generators.
Moderator: A material, such as ordinary water, heavy water, or graphite, that is used in a reactor to slow down high-velocity neutrons, thus increasing the likelihood of fission.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to Pressurised Heavy Water Reactor (PHWR), consider the following statements:
1. The reactor uses heavy water as moderator and liquid sodium as coolant.
2. It uses natural Uranium as fuel.
3. Most of the civil nuclear reactors in India are PHWR.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 2 only
(b) 1 and 3 only
(c) 2 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Pressurised Heavy Water Reactors (PHWR) are used under the first phase of India’s ambitious nuclear programme. 
Statement 1 is not correct: The reactor uses heavy water as moderator and as coolant also. There is no use of liquid sodium in the PHWR.
Statements 2 is correct: It uses natural uranium as fuel.                                                                                              Statements 3 is correct:Most of the civil nuclear reactors in India are PHWR (19 out of 24).
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT), consider the following statements:
1. It prohibits testing of nuclear weapons only on land and under sea.
2. The treaty will come into force after being ratified by all countries having a nuclear programme.
3. India became the first Asian Country to ratify the treaty. 
How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
The Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT) bans nuclear explosions by everyone.
Statement 1 is not correct: It prohibits nuclear weapon testing everywhere: on the Earth’s surface, in the atmosphere, underwater and underground and even in a simulated environment.                                                                                Statement 2 is correct: The treaty has a provision that it will come into force after being ratified by all countries having a nuclear programme                                                                                                                                                                    Statement 3 is not correct. The USA, India and few other nations have not signed the treaty, so the treaty is not yet operational.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to the Low Enriched Uranium (LEU)
1. It is made by enriching naturally occurring uranium to improve its ability to produce energy. 
2. It is the basic material to fabricate nuclear fuel.
3. It deteriorates quickly and hence; storage becomes a challenge.
How many of the above mentioned statements is/are correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: LEU is made by enriching naturally occurring uranium to improve its ability to produce energy.    Statement 2 is correct:Low Enriched Uranium (LEU) is the basic material to fabricate nuclear fuel. It consists of uranium hexafluoride that is a white-grey, waxy solid at standard temperature and pressure.  Enrichment increases the concentration of uranium atoms that can split to produce heat. This heat in turn is used to generate electricity.
statement 3 is incorrect:LEU does not deteriorate and can be safely stored for many years. LEU is not a nuclear waste, nor is any waste generated by simply storing it.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to India’s Nuclear Power Programme, consider the following pairs:
Stage—Fuel
1. First—Uranium-235
2. Second—Uranium-233
3. Third—Plutonium-239
Which of the pairs given above is/are correctly matched?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) 1 and 3 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
India has a three stage Nuclear Power Programme, which will use different nuclear fuels. 
1st stage uses Uranium-235 as fuel.
2nd stage uses Plutonium-239 as fuel.
3rd stage uses Uranium-233 as fuel.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to the Nuclear Energy
1. Nuclear Fission is more commonly used process for production of electricity from nuclear energy
2. Uranium-235 is the most commonly used fuel for the production of nuclear energy.
3. The International Energy Agency(IEA) establishes and promotes international standards for the safe and secure use of nuclear energy. 
How many of the above mentioned statements is/are correct?
(a) Only One
(b) Only Two
(c) All Three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Nuclear energy is a form of energy released from the nucleus, the core of atoms, made up of protons and neutrons. 
Statement 1 is Correct: Nuclear energy can be produced in two ways: fission or fusion. The nuclear energy harnessed around the world today to produce electricity is through nuclear fission, while technology to generate electricity from fusion is at the R&D phase. 
Statement 2 is Correct: Uranium-235 is most commonly used fuel to produce heat through fission. 
Statement 3 is Incorrect: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) establishes and promotes international standards and guidance for the safe and secure use of nuclear energy to protect people and the environment.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
How many of the above research reactors are currently operational in India ?
1. APSARA- U
2. CIRUS
3. DHRUV
4. ZERLINA
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 1 and 2 only
(b) 2 and 4 only
(c) 1, 3 and 4 only
(d) 1 and 3 only
batch.explanation:
Only two nuclear research reactors are operational currently: APSARA-U and DHRUV.
Apsara-U (Apsara- Upgraded) was successfully commissioned and its First Approach to Criticality (FAC) was achieved on 10th September 2018. Indigenously developed Low Enriched Uranium (LEU) fuel in Uranium Silicide form is used in the reactor. Hot water layer concept at the top of pool, which is first of a kind in India, is employed to minimize radiation dose.
DHRUVA: Construction of DHRUVA was an important milestone in the development and implementation of indigenous nuclear technology in India. The reactor incorporates several features catering to the requirements of a broad-based multidisciplinary user community as also in the production of radioisotopes of high specific activity. Dhruva has been declared as a National Facility for Neutron Beam Research to cater to the needs of Indian scientific community where scientists from BARC, other units of the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE), universities and national laboratories work under collaborative projects.
CIRUS and ZERLINA research reactors have been decommissioned.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Uranium Enrichment, often seen in the news, refers to which of the following?
(a) enrichment and reprocessing of the spent nuclear fuel rods.
(b) increasing the binding energy of the Uranium nucleus.
(c) conversion of Thorium-232 into Uranium-233.
(d) a process which increases the concentration of Uranium-235 in natural Uranium .
batch.explanation:
Uranium enrichment is the process of increasing the percentage of Uranium-235 from 0.7 percent in natural uranium to about 3 to 5 percent for use in fuel for nuclear reactors.
The nuclear fuel used in a nuclear reactor needs to have a higher concentration of the U235 isotope than that which exists in natural uranium ore. U235 when concentrated (or "enriched") is fissionable in light-water reactors. During fission, the nucleus of the atom splits apart producing both heat and extra neutrons. Under controlled conditions, these extra neutrons can cause additional, nearby atoms to fission and a nuclear reaction can be sustained. The heat energy released, by the controlled nuclear reaction within the nuclear reactor, can be harnessed to produce electricity. Commercially, the U235 isotope is enriched to 3 to 5% (from the natural state of 0.7%) and is then further processed to create nuclear fuel.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
How many of the above locations in India have operational nuclear power plants?
1. Kakrapar
2. Tarapur
3. Narora 
4. Kaiga 
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 1 and 3 only
(b) 1,2 and 4 only
(c)  2, 3 and 4 only
(d) 1, 2, 3 and 4
batch.explanation:
There are presently 22 reactors with a total capacity of 6780 MW in operation and one reactor, KAPP-3 (700 MW) has been connected to the grid on January 10, 2021. In addition, there are 8 reactors (including 500 MW PFBR being implemented by BHAVINI) totaling to 6000 MW under construction at various stages.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
India is establishing a Prototype Fast Breeder Nuclear Reactor (FBR) at how many of the given sites?
1. Kaiga 
2. Rawatbhata
3. Kalpakkam
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 3 only
(b) 1 and 2 only
(c) 2 and 3 only
(d) 1 and 3 only
batch.explanation:
A prototype Fast Breeder Reactor (FBR) with capacity of 500 MWe is presently being constructed at the Madras Atomic Power Station in Kalpakkam.
The PFBR is currently constructed by The Bharatiya Nabhikiya Vidyut Nigam Limited (BHAVINI) is a wholly owned Enterprise of Government of India under the administrative control of the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE). Once the PFBR goes into commercial power production, BHAVINI will be the second power utility in India after Nuclear Power Corporation of India (NPCIL), to use nuclear fuel sources to generate power.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following pairs:
Nuclear Power Plant — Location 
1. Narora Power Plant — Uttar Pradesh 
2. Kaiga Power Plant — Karnataka 
3. Kudankulam Power Plant — Andhra Pradesh 
Which of the pairs given above is/are correctly matched?
(a) 1 and 2 only
(b) 2 and 3 only
(c) 1 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3
batch.explanation:
Nuclear power is the fifth-largest source of electricity in India after thermal, hydroelectric and renewable sources of electricity. Presently, India has 22 nuclear power reactors operating in 7 states, with an installed capacity of 6780 MegaWatt electric (MWe) where18 reactors are Pressurised Heavy Water Reactors (PHWRs) and 4 are Light Water Reactors (LWRs).
Pair 1 is correctly matched: The Narora Nuclear Reactor in Narora, Uttar Pradesh, Northern India has two PHWR which offer a total capacity of 440MW.
Pair 2 is correctly matched: Kaiga Generating Station is a nuclear power generating station situated at Kaiga, near the river Kali, in Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka.
Pair 3 is not correctly matched: Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is the largest nuclear power station in India, situated in Kudankulam in the Tirunelveli district of the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT), consider the following statements:
1. Under it, a Nuclear Weapon state is not allowed to provide nuclear technology to a Non-Nuclear weapon state under any circumstances.
2. The treaty provides for an additional protocol, according to which IAEA can inspect a place based on intelligence reports.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty was an agreement signed in 1968 by several of the major nuclear and non-nuclear powers that pledged their cooperation in stemming the spread of nuclear technology. Under the provision of the treaty a nuclear weapon state is allowed to provide nuclear technology to a non-nuclear state for peaceful uses.
Statement 2 is correct: The treaty provides for an additional protocol, according to which IAEA can inspect any place based on intelligence reports besides the regular inspection provided under the Safeguard Agreement.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to Indian policy regarding nuclear weapons, consider the following statements:
1. India has a no first use policy of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states.
2. In case of bio-chemical attack, India can use nuclear weapons against a non-nuclear weapon state.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is  correct: India has a no first use policy of Nuclear Weapons, and is deemed as a self-imposed restriction by India as a responsible nuclear state. Under the no first use policy of nuclear weapons, India will never use a nuclear weapon against non-nuclear states.                                                                                                                                                  Statement 2 is correct: But in case of biological, chemical or biochemical attacks, India can use nuclear weapons against non-nuclear weapon states.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the  Convention on Supplementary Compensation for Nuclear Damage (CSC) , consider the following statements:
1. The convention was adopted in 1986 in response to Cernobyl accident.
2. It aims at establishing a minimum national compensation amount for a nuclear disaster.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is incorrect and Statement 2 is correct.                                                                                                                          The international nuclear liability regime consists of multiple treaties and was strengthened after the 1986 Chernobyl nuclear accident. The umbrella Convention on Supplementary Compensation (CSC) was adopted in 1997 with the aim of establishing a minimum national compensation amount.Even though India was a signatory to the CSC, Parliament ratified the convention only in 2016. 
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Fissile Material Cut-off Treaty (FMCT), consider the following statements:
1. The Fissile Material Cut-off Treaty (FMCT) came into effect in 1992 after ratification by more than 50 states.
2. FMCT prohibits signatory countries from producing weapon grade thorium.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statements 1 and 2 are not correct: The Fissile Material Cut-off Treaty (FMCT) is a proposed international agreement that would prohibit the production of highly-enriched uranium (HEU) and plutonium.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following countries.
1. India
2. Japan
3. China
4. Russia
5. South Africa
Which of the above countries are members of the International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor (ITER)?                                                                                                                                                            Select the correct answer using the code given below:
(a) 1, 3 and 4 only
(b) 2, 4 and 5 only
(c) 1, 2, 3 and 4 only
(d) 1, 2 and 3 only
batch.explanation:
ITER (initially the International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor), is an international nuclear fusion research and engineering megaproject aimed at creating energy by replicating, on Earth, the fusion processes of the Sun. Upon completion of construction of the main reactor and first plasma, planned for late 2025, it will be the world's largest magnetic confinement plasma physics experiment and the largest experimental tokamak nuclear fusion reactor. 
The ITER Members—China, the European Union, India, Japan, South Korea, Russia and the United States—are now engaged in a 35-year collaboration to build and operate the ITER experimental device, and together bring fusion to the point where a demonstration fusion reactor can be designed.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following minerals
1. Antimony
2. Cobalt
3. Copper
4. Graphite
How many of the minerals given above is/are identified as critical minerals by Government
of India?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) Only three
(d) All four
batch.explanation:
Government of India has identified 30 critical minerals namely, Antimony, Beryllium, Bismuth, Cobalt, Copper, Gallium, Germanium, Graphite, Hafnium, Indium, Lithium, Molybdenum, Niobium, Nickel, PGE, Phosphorous, Potash, REE, Rhenium, Silicon, Strontium, Tantalum, Tellurium, Tin, Titanium, Tungsten, Vanadium, Zirconium, Selenium and Cadmium.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
WIth reference to the Chandrayaan mission of ISRO,which of the following statements is correct?
(a) Chandrayaan-1 mission was launched by the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle.
(b) Objective of the Chandrayaan-3 is to demonstrate the ability to soft-land a lander and rover on the unexplored north pole of the Moon.
(c) Thus far, only four space agencies, the U.S, Russia, South Korea and China, have successfully soft-landed on the moon.
(d) Under Chandrayaan-2, the lander Pragyan and rover Vikram successfully carried out observations on the moon surface.
batch.explanation:
Chandrayaan-1 mission: It was launched in October 2008 and it orbited the Moon and performed a number of scientific experiments and observations. It was India's first lunar mission and the first to discover water on the Moon. It Involved an orbiter and an impactor, both of which were built by ISRO. It was launched by the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle and made more than 3,400 orbits around the Moon.
Chandrayaan-2 mission Launched on July 22, 2019, the Chandrayaan-2 mission’s Vikram lunar lander crashed on the Moon. Despite the setback, the mission wasn’t a complete failure as its Orbiter part kept on working normally and produced a handsome amount of data about the Moon. The lander Vikram and rover Pragyaan were carrying instruments to carry out observations on the surface.
Chandrayaan-3 Mission: Objective of the Chandrayaan-3 is to demonstrate the ability to soft-land a lander and rover on the unexplored south pole of the Moon. Thus far, only three countries, the U.S., Russia and China, have successfully soft-landed on the moon.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Chandrayaan-3, consider
the following statement
1. It consists of Lander and Rover
configuration.
2. It was launched by LVM3 from Sriharikota.
3. The propulsion module has Spectropolarimetry of Habitable Planet Earth (SHAPE) payload.
How many of the statement/s given is/are
correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) All three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: Chandrayaan-3 is a follow-on mission to Chandrayaan-2 to
demonstrate end-to-end capability in safe landing and roving on the lunar surface. It consists of
Lander and Rover configuration.
Statement 2 is correct: It will be launched by LVM3 from Sriharikota.
Statement 3 is correct: The propulsion module will carry the lander and rover configuration till
100 km lunar orbit. The propulsion module has Spectro-polarimetry of Habitable Planet Earth
(SHAPE) payload to study the spectral and Polari metric measurements of Earth from the lunar
orbit.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Chandrayaan-3 mission, How many of the above statements is/are correct?
1. The Lander module of the mission is expected to land near the North Pole of the Moon. 
2. Launch Vehicle used for the mission was GSLV Mark II
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Chandrayaan-3 mission is expected to land on the South Pole of the Moon. If everything goes well, Chandrayaan-3 will be the world’s first mission to soft-land near the lunar south pole.
Statement 2 is not correct: The launcher used for Chandrayaan-3 mission is LVM 3 (earlier known as GSLV Mark III)
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to Indian Lunar missions, consider the following statements:
1. Chandrayaan-1 is India's first mission to Moon and was launched in early1990s.
2. Chandrayaan-3 is aimed at exploring the north side of the Moon.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2 
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Chandrayaan-1, India's first mission to Moon, was launched successfully on October 22, 2008 from SDSC SHAR, Sriharikota. The spacecraft was orbiting around the Moon at a height of 100 km from the lunar surface for chemical, mineralogical and photo-geologic mapping of the Moon.
Statement 2 is not correct: Chandrayaan-3 is aimed at exploring the South Pole of the Moon. 
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Aditya L-1, consider the following statement
Statement I: This spacecraft will be placed in a halo orbit around the Lagrange point 1 (L1) of the Sun-Earth system, which is about 1.5 million km from the Earth.
Statement II: A satellite placed in the halo orbit around the L1 point has the major disadvantage of continuously blocking the Sun through occultation/eclipses.
Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements? 
(a) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is the correct explanation for Statement-I 
(b) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is not the correct explanation for Statement-I 
(c) Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect
(d) Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct
batch.explanation:
Statement I is correct: Aditya L1 will be the first space based Indian mission to study the
Sun. The spacecraft will be placed in a halo orbit around the Lagrange point 1 (L1) of the SunEarth system, which is about 1.5 million km from the Earth.
Statement II is not correct: A satellite placed in the halo orbit around the L1 point has the major advantage of continuously viewing the Sun without any occultation/eclipses. This will provide a greater advantage of observing the solar activities and its effect on space weather in real time.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. There are five Lagrange points in the Earth-Sun system.
2. ISRO’s Aditya Mission plans to place the spacecraft in a halo orbit around the Lagrangian point 1 (L1), as it is the most stable Lagrange point. 
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct: The Lagrange Points are positions where the gravitational pull of two large masses precisely equals the centripetal force required for a small object to move with them. There are five such Lagrange Points in the Earth-Sun system. 
Statement 2 is not correct: Of the five Lagrange points, three are unstable and two are stable. L1, L2 and L3 are unstable, whereas L4 and L5 are stable points. ISRO’s Aditya Mission plans to place the spacecraft in a halo orbit around the L1 because this position has the major advantage of continuously viewing the Sun without any interruption like occultation/ eclipse. 
Therefore, option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to Solar Orbiter Mission, consider the following statements:
1. It is a joint mission of NASA and ISRO to study the sun’s corona.
2. Solar orbiter is traveling inside the orbit of Mercury.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
(a) 1 only
(b) 2 only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: The Solar Orbiter, a collaborative mission between the European Space Agency and NASA to study the Sun, was launched in February, 2020.
Statement 2 is correct: The Sun creates what’s known as the heliosphere — a giant bubble of charged particles and magnetic fields blown outward by the Sun that stretches more than twice the distance to Pluto at its nearest edge, enveloping every planet in our solar system and shaping the space around us. To understand it, Solar Orbiter is traveling as close as 26 million miles from the Sun, inside the orbit of Mercury to measure the magnetic fields, waves, energetic particles and plasma escaping the Sun while they are still in their pristine state, before being modified and mixed in their long journey from the Sun.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following pairs
Mission Launched      Country
1. MAVEN                  USA
2. Hope                      Saudi Arabia
3. Curiosity                 France
How many of the pair/s given above is/are
correctly matched?
(a) Only one pair
(b) Only two pair
(c) All three pair
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Pair 1 is correct: The Mars Atmosphere and
Volatile EvolutioN (MAVEN) mission is of
NASA,USA
Pair 2 is not correct: UAE’s Mars Mission
“Hope “ is the first probe to provide a complete
picture of the Martian atmosphere and its layers.
It was not launched by Saudi Arabia.
Pair 3 is not correct: Curiosity is NASA’s Mars
Science Laboratory mission which is the largest
and most capable rover ever sent to Mars.
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. Gravitational lensing is a phenomenon, which occurs when a huge amount of matter creates a gravitational field that distorts and magnifies the light from objects behind it.
2. TEMPLATES is a mission by the European Space Agency that aims to find how new stars are born.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
(a) 1 Only
(b) 2 Only
(c) Both 1 and 2
(d) Neither 1 nor 2
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is correct:Gravitational lensing is a phenomenon, which occurs when a huge amount of matter, such as a massive galaxy or cluster of galaxies, creates a gravitational field that distorts and magnifies the light from objects behind it, but in the same line of sight.
Statement 2 is incorrect:NASA is using the James Webb Space Telescope to conduct wide range of investigations across the fields of astronomy and cosmology. NASA is planning to investigate how new stars are born. For this, they will take the help of a natural phenomenon called “gravitational lensing”. This programme is called TEMPLATES (Targeting Extremely Magnified Panchromatic Lensed Arcs and Their Extended Star Formation).
Therefore option (a) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Which of the following  is not correct about India’s Gaganyaan mission?
(a) The crew members of the mission will be called Vyomnuts.
(b) The mission will place the spacecraft in Medium Earth Orbit.
(c) A LVM3 rocket will be used in the mission.
(d) India has partnered with Russia to train crew members aboard the mission.
batch.explanation:
India is planning to launch a manned space mission named Gaganyaan. The crew members aboard the spacecraft will be called Vyomnuts. The LVM3 rocket will be used to launch the mission, and the rocket will place the spacecraft in the Lower Earth Orbit (LEO) at around 300 KMs above the earth surface. India has partnered with Russia for training of the crew members as Russia has an expertise in sending manned missions in space. Currently the training mission is ongoing in Russia.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Recently, which country has announced its plan to withdraw from the International Space Station(ISS) programme and launch its own orbital space station by 2025?
(a)  Canada
(b)  China 
(c)  Japan
(d)  Russia
batch.explanation:
Russian Space Agency Roscosmos recently announced its plan to launch its own orbital space as it was considering withdrawing from the International Space Station(ISS) programme. Launched in 1998 and involving Russia, the United States, Canada, Japan, and the European Space Agency, the ISS is one of the most ambitious international collaborations in human history.
Therefore option (d) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Weakly Interacting Massive Particles (WIMPS) are related to which  of the following?
(a) Dark Energy
(b) Antimatter
(c) Dark matter
(d) Higgs Boson
batch.explanation:
Weakly interacting massive particles (WIMP) are heavy, electromagnetically neutral subatomic particles. They are believed to make up most dark matter.
Therefore option (c) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
With reference to the Dark Matter, consider the
following statements
1. It constitute 70 percent of universe and
responsible for the expansion of universe.
2. It is invisible because it does not interact
with light.
3. Euclid is a European spacecraft to study
dark matter
How many of the statement/s given is/are
correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) All three
(d) None
batch.explanation:
Statement 1 is not correct: Dark energy constitute 70 percent of universe and responsible
for the expansion of universe and not the Dark Matter.
Statement 2 is correct: It is invisible because it does not interact with light.
Statement 3 is correct: Euclid is a planned mission to investigate the profound cosmic
mysteries of dark matter and dark energy.It was developed by the European Space Agency (ESA) and the Euclid Consortium and was launched on 1 July 2023.
Therefore option (b) is the correct answer.
batch.subject: Science and Technology

batch.text:
Which of the following is associated with the term Accretion Disc?
(a) Black hole
(b) Moon’s south pole
(c) Asteroid belt of Solar System
(d) Saturn rings
batch.explanation:
